spell.name: Aether Lance
entries: You gather a spear of magic in your hand and expel it as a 30 foot lance of raw power in a direction you choose. Each creature in that line takes {@damage 8d4} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Aether Storm
entries: You conjure a storm of aether erupting from a point of your choice within range. The aether storm fills a 10-foot radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point. When the storm appears, each creature within its area takes {@damage 8d4} force damage.

A creature takes {@damage 1d4} force damage for each 5 feet they move through the storm, and if a creature ends their turn within the aether storm, they take {@damage 8d4} force damage. On your turn, you can move the storm 10 feet in any direction as a bonus action.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Arcane Strength
entries: For the duration of the spell, your veins glow and pulse with magical energy. Until the spell ends, you gain the following benefits.

items: Whenever anything requires you to use your Strength modifier, you can use your Charisma modifier instead (i.e. melee attacks, acrobatics checks, Strength saving throws).
You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn. You ignore this benefit if you already have a feature, like Extra Attack, that gives you extra attacks.

Your fists become natural melee weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your Charisma modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries: Immediately after the spell ends, you must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd- or 4th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 2d6}. When you cast it using a 5th- or 6th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 3d6}. When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases to {@dice 4d6}. The DC to avoid a level of {@condition exhaustion} at the end of the spell also decreases by 1 for each damage increase.

spell.name: Arctic Breath
entries: A line of freezing arctic wind 30 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d6} cold damage and their movement speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't slowed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Arundel's Flame Blade

components.m: a leaf of sumac

entries: You evoke a fiery blade in your free hand. The blade is similar in size and shape to a scimitar, and it lasts for the duration. It counts as a simple melee weapon with the light property with which you are proficient and deals {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a hit. Moreover, when you make a melee attack with the Flame Blade, you can add your spellcasting modifier instead of your strength modifier to both the hit and damage rolls. If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can evoke the blade again as a bonus action.

While wielding the Flame Blade, you can cast {@spell green flame blade} as an action (the Flame Blade counting as the weapon required for the Material Component of that spell). When you cast {@spell green flame blade} this way, it counts as a druid spell for you if you are a druid, or a sorcerer spell if you are sorcerer. The flaming blade sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Bad Blood

components.m: a piece of rotten meat

entries: Targeting a creature you can see within range, you attempt to corrupt it's blood. Creatures without blood are immune to this effect. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On failure, they take {@damage 1d12} damage and become {@condition poisoned} for the duration.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target. On a failure, they take an additional {@damage 1d4} poison damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional target for each slot level above 2nd. The targets must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Bigby's Enlarge/Reduce

components.m: a pinch of powdered iron

entries: You cause a creature or an object you can see within range to grow larger or smaller for the duration. Choose either a creature or an object that is neither worn nor carried. If the target is unwilling, it can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect.
If the target is a creature, everything it is wearing and carrying changes size with it. Any item dropped by an affected creature returns to normal size at once.

Enlarge. The target's size doubles in all dimensions, and its weight is multiplied by eight. This growth increases its size by one category--from Medium to Large, for example. Alternatively, you can cause a creature's size category to become Large, increasing its size and weight by a similar factor. If there isn't enough room for the target to achieve its new size, the creature or object attains the maximum possible size in the space available. Until the spell ends, the target also has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also grow to match its new size. While these weapons are enlarged, the target's attacks with them deal {@damage 1d4} extra damage.

Reduce. The target's size is halved in all dimensions, and its weight is reduced to one-eighth of normal. This reduction decreases its size by one category--from Medium to Small, for example. Until the spell ends, the target also has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also shrink to match its new size. While these weapons are reduced, the target's attacks with them deal {@damage 1d4} less damage (this can't reduce the damage below 1).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can cause a creature's size to become Huge, and its weapons deal an additional {@damage 2d6} damage.

spell.name: Blackout

components.m: a lit candle, which the spell puts out

entries: Until the spell ends, nonmagical sources of light are suppressed while you are within 20 feet of them, causing them to generate no light. This spell does not block light that originates from sources outside the range of its effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the range of the effect increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 1st. At 2nd level, light created by a cantrip is also suppressed. At 3rd level, lights created by 1st level spells are suppressed, etc.

spell.name: Booming Bellow

components.m: a megaphone

entries: You emit a sonic blast covering a huge area. Each creature in a 120 foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d8} damage if they are within 60 feet of you, or {@damage 3d8} damage if they are further than 60 feet from you. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Bow of Light
entries: You weave together threads of light, creating a longbow of pure radiance in your hand. This magic weapon lasts until the spell ends. It counts as a martial ranged weapon with which you are proficient. It deals {@damage 2d8} radiant damage on a hit and has the two-handed and range (150/300 ft.) properties. The bow magically creates its own ammunition. In addition, the bow sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
If you drop the weapon, it dissipates at the end of the turn. Thereafter, while the spell persists, you can use a bonus action to cause the bow to reappear in your hand with an arrow nocked.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd- or 4th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 3d8}. When you cast it using a 5th- or 6th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 4d8}. When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases to {@dice 5d8}.

spell.name: Chains of Flame
entries: A long chain whip made of pure fire appears in either one or each of your hands (your choice). These magic weapons last until the spell ends. The whips count as martial weapons with which you are proficient. They deal {@damage 2d4} fire damage on a hit and have the finesse, light, and reach properties. You can use your spellcasting modifier instead of your strength or dexterity for both the attack and damage rolls when you attack with a lava whip. When you cast this spell, you can make an attack with one of the lava whips as part of the same bonus action.

The whips shed dim light in a 10 foot radius. Once per round when you attack with the whips, you can force the target to make a dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, becoming {@condition grappled} by you on a failure. You can use this ability to grapple a target more than one size larger than you, however their movement speed is not reduced. Instead, when they move, they drag you along behind them. As an action, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the grapple on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd- or 4th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 2d6}. When you cast it using a 5th- or 6th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 3d6} When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases to {@dice 4d6}.

spell.name: Chilling Darkness

components.m: silver and a drop of pitch or piece of coal

entries: Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 30-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. Non-magical light, as well as light created by spells of 5th level or lower, can't illuminate the area, and creatures with darkvision can't see through it.

The area inside the darkness is lightly obscured and frigid cold. Any creature that starts its turn within the sphere must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 4d6} cold damage and its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the start of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half damage an its speed isn't reduced.

spell.name: Cold Snap

components.m: a vial of white colored water

entries: A swirling burst of freezing wind erupts at a point you choose within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d8} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The ground in the area is covered with slick ice, making it difficult terrain until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Crackle
entries: You create three arcs of lightning, each arc striking a single target within range. You can direct them at one target or several.

Make a ranged spell attack for each arc. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} lightning damage. If three or more arcs hit a single target, they must make a Constitution saving throw or become shocked, causing them to be {@condition stunned} until the start of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional arc for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Dark Scythe
entries: You weave together threads of darkness to create a large scythe of solidified shadows in your hand. This magic weapon lasts until the spell ends. It counts as a simple weapon with which you are proficient. It deals {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage on a hit and has the two-handed and the reach properties. When you attack with this weapon, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier instead of your strength modifier for both the attack and damage rolls.

When you hit a creature with this scythe as an attack action, that creature cannot make an opportunity attack against you until the end of your turn. In addition, as an action, you can swing the dark scythe in a wide arc in front of you. Each creature in a 10 foot cube originating from you must make a dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage on a failure or half as much on a success. When you use this ability, the spell ends.
If you drop the weapon, it dissipates at the end of the turn. Thereafter, while the spell persists, you can use a bonus action to cause the scythe to reappear in your hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd- or 4th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 3d8}. When you cast it using a 5th- or 6th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 4d8}. When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases to {@dice 5d8}.

spell.name: Echoing Lance

components.m: a didgeridoo

entries: You emit a targeted burst of intense sonic energy at a target within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On failure, they take {@damage 3d8} thunder damage and becomes {@condition stunned} for the duration by the intense sound. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition stunned}.

At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target. On a failure, they take an additional {@damage 1d8} thunder damage from the echoes within the mind.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Electrocute

components.m: a strip of copper and a piece of zinc suspended in sulfuric acid

entries: A massive arc of lightning leaps from your hand to a target you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 4d12} lightning damage and is {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Entomb
entries: You attempt to encase a creature within 60 feet that you can see within ice. The creature must make a Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} by ice for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target takes {@damage 1d8} cold damage and can make another Strength saving throw. On success, the spell ends on the target.
If the creature takes more than 5 fire or bludgeoning damage from a single damage roll while {@condition restrained}, the ice breaks and the target is freed, ending the spell for the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Erode

components.m: A small container of vinegar

entries: You blast a target that you can see within range with mass of acid. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On failure, the target takes {@damage 8d4} acid damage immediately and becomes covered in acid, taking an additional {@damage 2d4} acid damage at the end of each of its turns until it or a creature within 5 feet of it uses their action to scrape or wash the acid off of the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage (both initial and later) increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Field of Stars

components.m: a golden orb engraved with designs worth at least 150 gp.

entries: You cause 5 star-like motes of light to spring forth at points you can see within range. Each mote of light must be at least 10 feet from any other mote of light. Each mote of light sheds bright light in a 10 foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. If a creature moves within a 5-foot radius of a mote of light or ends their turn within 5 feet of one, the mote explodes in a brilliant flash, dealing {@damage 4d12} radiant damage to all creatures within 5-feet of that mote before fading away.

For the duration of the spell, while you have any motes of light remaining, as an action you can rearrange the remaining motes, placing them anywhere within range (this movement cannot cause them to detonate).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the range increases by 10 feet and you create an additional star-like mote of light for each slot level about 5th.

spell.name: Fissure

components.m: a custom made rock hammer worth at least 50gp

entries: You rend the earth asunder in a 60-foot-long 5-feet-wide line. Creatures in that line must make a dexterity save. On a failure, a creature falls into a suddenly opened crevice in the ground, falling into it before it snaps shut, crushing them.

From the fall and crush, creatures that fail the saving throw take {@damage 6d10} bludgeoning damage. The creature is buried in 10 feet of rubble, and creatures without a borrowing speed require 30 feet of movement to extract themselves from the loose rubble to return to where they failed the saving throw. If they end their turn while buried, they take an additional {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage.

spell.name: Fizban's Chaos Bolt
entries: You hurl an undulating, warbling mass of chaotic energy at one creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} damage. Choose one of the d8s. The number rolled on that die determines the attack’s damage type, as shown below.

If you roll the same number on 2 of the d8s and choose the damage type associated with that number, the chaotic energy leaps from the target to a different creature of your choice within 30 feet of it. Make a new attack roll against the new target, and make a new damage roll, which could cause the chaotic energy to leap again. Each time the bolt leaps, the damage is reduced by {@dice 1d8}.
A creature can be targeted only once by each casting of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, each target takes {@damage 1d8} extra damage of the type rolled for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Flash Freeze

components.m: a white or silver dragon scale

entries: A freezing wind ripples outward. Each creature in a 40-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. On a fail save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} cold damage and is {@condition restrained} by ice until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition restrained}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Force Blade
entries: You create an oversized blade of pure scintillating force energy in your hand. For the duration of the spell, as an action, you can sweep the blade through up to four five foot cubes within five feet of you (the cubes must be connected on at least one face), dealing {@damage 6d4} force damage to each creature in that area.

spell.name: Force Bolt
entries: You hurl a mote of arcane energy at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d4} force damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 2d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 4d4}), 11th level ({@dice 6d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 8d4}).

spell.name: Force Cleave

components.m: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp, currently being wielded in 2 hands

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell’s casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack’s normal effects and takes an additional {@damage 2d6} force damage if its movement speed is currently reduced by any effect.

This spell’s damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage to the target on a hit, and the extra force damage increases to {@dice 3d6}. Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d6} at 11th level ({@dice 2d6} and {@dice 4d6}) and again at 17th level ({@dice 3d6} and {@dice 5d6}).

spell.name: Force Field
entries: You gain the same benefits as if you used the dodge action. Additionally, the next creature that hits you with a melee attack while this spell is active must succeed on a strength saving throw or take force damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier, be pushed 5 feet from you, and be knocked {@condition prone}. Once a creature has hit you, the spell ends (and you no longer benefit from the advantages of the dodge action).

This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the force damage increases to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. That damage roll increases again by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@dice 2d8}) and once again at 17th level ({@dice 3d8}).

spell.name: Frosted Arrow

components.m: a ranged weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell’s casting and make a ranged attack with it against one creature within the weapon's range. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack’s normal effects and its movement speed is reduced by 10ft. for the duration of the spell.

This spell’s damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the ranged attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} cold damage to the target on a hit. That damage roll increase by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@dice 2d8}) and again at 17th level ({@dice 3d8}).

spell.name: Grasping Tether

components.m: A small piece of elastic

entries: You send out a grasping tether of force from a creature you can see within range, choosing one object or creature that you can see of up to medium size within 20 feet of the target. The tether latches onto the second target, who must succeed a Strength saving throw (objects fail automatically) or be launched through the air towards the initial target, colliding with them and dealing bludgeoning damage equal to the amount shown below.
• Tiny: {@dice 2d6}
• Small or medium: {@dice 2d8}
• Large: {@dice 3d10}
• Huge: {@dice 5d10}

The secondary target lands {@condition prone} in the nearest unoccupied space to the initial target but takes no damage from this spell, and the primary target must make a Strength saving throw, also being knocked {@condition prone} on a failure. For each size category difference between the primary and secondary targets, a modifier of 2 is applied to the saving throw rolled. The modifier is negative if the secondary target is smaller and positive if it is larger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each spell level above 1st, one additional tether is created. Each tether can target a separate creature or the same creature. Two tethers are required to launch an object or creature of Large size, and three tethers are required to launch an object or creature of Huge size. A creature larger than Huge cannot be moved.

spell.name: Ice Blades
entries: You summon three sharp blades of ice that hover around you for the duration. As an action, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 20 feet of you with these blades a number of times equal to the number of blades remaining, dealing {@damage 2d4} cold damage on a hit. Alternatively, you can attack once as a bonus action.
When you are hit by an attack, you can sacrifice one of these blades as a reaction to gain a +2 bonus to AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss.

Finally, you can expend a spell slot of any level as an action while this spell is active to sacrifice a number of blades equal to the level of spell slot used. Each sacrificed blade is immediately shot out, as though you had cast {@spell ice knife} as a 1st level spell once per blade.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you summon an additional blade for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ice Blades
entries: You summon three sharp blades of ice that hover around you for the duration. As an action, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 20 feet of you with these blades a number of times equal to the number of blades remaining, dealing {@damage 2d4} cold damage on a hit. Alternatively, you can attack once as a bonus action.
When you are hit by an attack, you can sacrifice one of these blades as a reaction to gain a +2 bonus to AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss.

Finally, you can expend a spell slot of any level as an action while this spell is active to sacrifice a number of blades equal to the level of spell slot used. Each sacrificed blade is immediately shot out, as though you had cast {@spell ice knife} as a 1st level spell once per blade.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you summon an additional blade for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ice Spikes

components.m: a white powder coating the bottom of your shoe or the palm of your hand

entries: You stomp your foot on the ground or slam your hand down, creating lances of ice that shoot up from the ground to impale a creature within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} piercing damage and {@damage 4d8} cold damage on a failed save. On a successful save, the target only takes the cold damage.
If any of your piercing damage rolls is an 8, the target is wounded and their speed is reduced by 10ft until they receive at least 20 points of magical healing.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the speed reduction of the target is increased by 5ft, and the amount of healing that the target must receive to restore their speed is increased by 10 points.

spell.name: Jumping Jolt

components.m: a piece of zinc

entries: You release an arc of lighting at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack roll against the target. On hit, the target takes {@damage 4d12} lightning damage, and you can cause the spell to jump to another target within 20 feet of the first target making a new attack roll for each target. The spell cannot hit the same target twice, or jump to a target out of the spells range. The spell can jump a maximum of five times.
On a miss, the target takes half as much damage and the spell does not jump to a new target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the starting damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Leaf Blades
entries: Two short swords made of sharp leaves appear in your hands. These magic weapons last until the spell ends. The leaf blades count as a martial weapon with which you are proficient. They deal {@damage 1d10} slashing damage on a hit and have the light and finesse properties. When you cast that spell, you can make an attack with one of the leaf blades as part of the same bonus action.

In addition, as an action, you can throw the leaves in front of you in a slashing tempest. When you do so, every enemy in a 20 feet cone must make a dexterity saving throw against your spell DC, taking {@damage 4d4} slashing damage on a fail, or half as much on a success.

If you drop one or both of the leaf blades, or if you throw the leaves in front of you, while the spell persists you can use a bonus action to cause the leaves to come back in your hands and reform the blades. When you do so, you can make an attack with one of the leaf blades as part of the same bonus action.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 4th- or 5th-level spell slot, the damage of the blades increases to {@dice 2d10}, and the damage of slashing tempest increases to {@dice 6d4}.
When you cast it using a 6th- or 7th-level spell slot, the damage of the blades increases to {@dice 3d10}, and the damage of slashing tempest increases to {@dice 8d4}.
When you cast it using a 8th- or 9th-level spell slot, the damage of the blades increases to {@dice 4d10}, and the damage of slashing tempest increases to {@dice 10d4}.

spell.name: Leomund's Blade Ward
entries: You extend your hand and trace a sigil of warding in the air. You can have one sigil active at a time.

When you take bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage dealt by a weapon attack, you can use your reaction to activate the sigil. When you do so, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the end of the turn, the spell then ends.
You can have one additional sigil active from this cantrip when you reach 5th level (2 sigils), 11th level (3 sigils), and 17th level (4 sigils).

spell.name: Lightning Tendril

components.m: a twig from a tree that has been struck by lightning

entries: Crackling beams of blue energy leap from your hands. For the duration of the spell, as an action, you can direct them toward a creature within range, dealing {@damage 1d12} lightning damage to that creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd Level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} and the range increases by 15 feet for every spell level above 1st.

spell.name: Melf's Dancing Lights

components.m: a bit of phosphorus or wychwood, or a glowworm

entries: You create up to three torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. Each light sheds dim light in a 10 foot radius.

You can also combine the three lights into one glowing vaguely humanoid form of Medium size. When you combine the lights this way, the glowing humanoid sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius, and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A light winks out if it exceeds the spell's range.

spell.name: Nauseating Poison
entries: You coat your hand, a weapon you are holding, or a natural weapon in dark ichor. After casting this spell, if you make a successful melee spell attack, unarmed strike or a melee weapon attack, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d12} poison damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.
The spell ends after dealing damage, or at the start of your next turn, whichever occurs first.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Orbital Stones

components.m: the ground at your feet

entries: You lift three small to medium rocks or similar objects from within 10 feet of you, causing them to defy gravity and slowly circle you in your space. While any stones orbit you, if you are targeted by a weapon attack or make a dexterity saving throw from an effect that originates 5 feet or more from you, roll a {@dice d4}. If the result is lower than the number of stones circling you, the attack hits the stone instead. A stone is destroyed if it takes more than 20 damage from a single attack, and all the stones are vulnerable to bludgeoning, thunder, and force damage.

As a bonus action while at least one object remains in orbit, you can magically fling it at target within 60 feet. Make a ranged spell attack roll. On hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} bludgeoning damage and is knocked backward 5 feet.

spell.name: Pillar of Earth

components.m: a smooth pebble

entries: You cause a pillar of stone to rise from the ground in a space you can see. The pillar of stone has a diameter of 5 feet and raises up to 30 feet into the air. The ground where a pillar appears must be wide enough for its diameter, and you can target the ground under a creature if that creature is Medium or smaller.

If a pillar is created under a creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be lifted by the pillar. On a success, they are pushed to an empty adjacent square if one is available. If there is no empty square adjacent, the creature is lifted regardless of the saving throw. A creature can choose to fail their save. If a pillar is prevented from reaching its full height because of a ceiling or other obstacle, any creature on the pillar takes {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage and is {@condition restrained}, pinched between the pillar and the obstacle. The {@condition restrained} creature can use an action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (the creature’s choice) against your spell save DC. On a success, the creature is no longer {@condition restrained} and must either move off the pillar or fall off it.

The pillar has AC 5 and 30 hit points. When reduced to 0 hit points, the pillar crumbles into rubble, which creates an area of difficult terrain with a 10-foot radius that lasts until the rubble is cleared. Each 5-foot-diameter portion of the area requires at least 1 minute to clear by hand.

spell.name: Poison Dart
entries: You conjure a dart of pure poison and hurl it a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On hit, the target takes {@damage 3d12} poison damage and must make a constitution saving throw. If you roll a 12 on any of the damage dice, the target makes this saving throw with disadvantage. On a failure, they become {@condition poisoned} until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Poison Puff

components.m: the seed of a nightshade plant

entries: You exhale a cloud of poison that quickly magically expands to fill a 30 foot cone. Creatures in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, they take {@damage 4d12} poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} until the start of your next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition poisoned}.
The area is lightly obscured until the start of your turn, and any creature that ends their turn within the area takes {@damage 2d4} poison damage.

spell.name: Power Chord
entries: You send a potent musical chord towards a creature within range, assaulting their senses with notes of power. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 5d4} damage of a type that you choose, either fire, lightning, or thunder. The secondary effect of the spell changes depending on which damage type you choose.
Fire: The target takes additional fire damage at the end of its next turn equal to one roll of your Bardic Inspiration die.
Lightning: The target makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it can't take a reaction until the start of its next turn.
Thunder: The target is knocked 5ft away from you.
This spell cannot be learned by any class other than Bard.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Prismatic Shield

components.m: a bracelet of shield charms worth at least 50 gp, or a shield worth at least 1 sp

entries: You conjure up a shield of shifting colors that takes a form you choose, allowing you to protect yourself from various forms of damage.

When you cast this spell, choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, radiant, or thunder damage. You gain resistance to this damage type. As a reaction to taking one of these damage types, you can shift the color of the shield and gain resistance to the triggering damage type, including the triggering attack.
In addition, when a creature hits you with a melee attack, they take {@damage 1d8} damage of the type you currently resist.

spell.name: Secret Sword

components.m: a vaguely weapon shaped object

entries: You transform an ordinary object or instrument into an adorned magical melee weapon that resembles its original form, adding blades or spikes if you choose. No matter what type of weapon it appears to be, it has the finesse property and deals {@damage 1d8} damage on a hit. The damage type is either bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing, depending on what type would be most appropriate to the weapon's form. You are considered proficient with this weapon.
The object you transform can still be used for its original function, and when the spell ends it turns back into its original form, undamaged.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd- or 4th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 2d8} and the weapon gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When you cast it using a 5th- or 6th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 3d8} and the bonus becomes +2. When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases to {@dice 4d8} and the bonus becomes +3.

spell.name: Seeking Orb

components.m: a humanoid effigy made of wood

entries: You create a tiny orb of pure arcane energy that appears within 5 feet of you and designate a target creature that within 120 feet you can see. For the duration of the spell, at the end of each of your turns, the orb will move 30 feet directly toward the creature. If the orb reaches the target, it will detonate dealing {@damage 6d4} force damage to the target and ending the spell. If the orb does not reach the target before the spell ends, it fades away without dealing damage.

spell.name: Shield of Ice
entries: A thick layer of ice gathers around one of your free hands, forming a protecting shield. For the duration of the spell, you gain +2 AC and every instance of damage you take is reduced by 3. For the purpose of all abilities and effects, this shield counts as a normal shield. The shield can block a total of 30 damage before it is destroyed and is vulnerable to fire damage, but grants you resistance to fire damage.
In addition, once per round, if you make a strength or dexterity saving throw while wielding this shield, you can use your spellcasting ability saving throw instead.

If you drop the shield for any reason, the spell ends. Someone attempting to take the shield from you must make a strength check against your spell save DC in order to do so. Regardless of whether they succeed or fail, they take {@damage 2d8} cold damage. This shield cannot be incorporated into any form that does not have hands.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage reduction increases by 1, the shield HP increases by 5, and the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Shining Arrow

components.m: a ranged weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell’s casting and make a ranged attack with it against one creature within the weapon's range. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack’s normal effects, and you can cause the light to pierce through the creature and hit a second creature on a same line and within 15 feet of the first one. The second creature takes radiant damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

This spell’s damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the ranged attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage to the target on a hit, and the radiant damage to the second creature increases to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@dice 2d8} and {@dice 2d8}) and 17th level ({@dice 3d8} and {@dice 3d8}).

spell.name: Skyburst

components.m: an iron rod or a staff of wood worth at least 1 cp

entries: Five bolts of lightning strike five points of your choice that you can see within range. Each point must be at least 10 feet from all other selected points. Each creature within 5 feet of the chosen points must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d12} damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can call down an additional bolt of lightning targeting another point within range for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Spectral Weapon
entries: You summon a glowing melee weapon of magical energy, swinging it out at a creature within reach. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 1d6+3} of a damage type that you choose from one of your other cantrips.
If you have no damage dealing cantrips, this spell deals no damage.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6+3} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6+6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6+9}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6+12}).

spell.name: Spider Bite

components.m: a spider's fang or a wasp stinger

entries: You prick a target with tiny magical fang of venom. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within reach. On hit, the spell ends, the target takes {@damage 3d12} poison damage and must pass a Constitution saving throw or becoming {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned}, the target must make another constitution saving throw at the end of each of their turns. On a failure, the target gains 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}. On a success, nothing happens. After 2 successes, the target is no longer {@condition poisoned} and their levels of {@condition exhaustion} are halved, rounding down. They also become immune to this spell's {@condition exhaustion} effect for 24 hours.

Additionally, for each damage dice that rolls a 12, the target makes a saving throw against this spell with disadvantage. These disadvantaged saving throws must start with the first one and be made sequentially. This saving throw cannot gain disadvantage from any other source.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Star Dust
entries: You evoke a burst of brilliant particles of force energy sweeping out in a 15-foot cube originating from you. Creatures in the area take {@damage 3d4} force damage and the first attack roll made against them before the start of your next turn has advantage.

spell.name: Stinging Swarm

components.m: a stinging insect preserved in amber

entries: You conjure a magical swarm of flying insects within range which lasts for the duration. For the duration of the spell, the swarm is magically replenishing and cannot be destroyed. As a bonus action, you can direct the swarm to move up to 30 feet. If the swarm enters another creature's space, it stops and swarms them, stinging repeatedly. The creature takes {@damage 6d4} piercing damage and must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d12} poison damage on failure.
Additionally, any creature sharing the same square as the swarm is {@condition blinded} as long as they remain there.

spell.name: Stone Fist
entries: You turn your hand and forearm (or similar appendage) to stone until the start of your next turn. You can make a melee spell attack against one creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage.

If you hit a creature with an opportunity attack using your stone fist, the target is knocked {@condition prone}. If multiple creatures are making an opportunity attack against the same target, your attack will be resolved first.
Until the start of your next turn, when you take slashing or piercing damage from an attack, you can use your reaction to gain resistance to that instance of damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Stone Greathammer
entries: You place your hand on a surface of stone, and any stones and rocks nearby assemble to form a gigantic hammer. It counts as a martial weapon with which you are proficient. It deals {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage on a hit and has the heavy, reach, and two-handed properties. When you use the attack action while wielding the massive stone hammer, you can make a shove attack as a bonus action. The damage dealt by the greathammer is not considered magical.

If you drop the weapon, the stones and rocks disperse on the ground at the end of the turn. Thereafter, while the spell persists, you can use a bonus action touch the ground to cause the hammer to reappear in your hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd or 4th level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 3d10}. When you cast it using a 5th or 6th level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 4d10}. When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases to {@dice 5d10}.

spell.name: Thunder Punch
entries: You charge your hand (or similar appendage) with thunderous power. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} thunder damage, and is knocked 10 feet away from you if it is Large or smaller.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Thunderpulse

components.m: an engraved ring

entries: You gather sonic energy and can expel it in shockwaves for the duration. Until the spell ends, the you can use an action emit a shockwave in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 3d8} thunder damage and being knocked 10 feet away from you on a failed save, or half as much damage and not being knocked away on a successful one.

You can use this spell to make thunder assisted jumps, expelling the energy behind or below you to double your normal jump distance or height for that round. Additionally, while this spell is active, you can use your reaction to shoot a blast of thunder below you to slow your fall, reducing your falling speed to 60 feet per round and negating any fall damage if you impact a surface during that round.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Venomous Sting

components.m: a dart or blowgun worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell’s casting and make a ranged attack with it against one creature within its range. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack’s normal effects and takes an extra {@damage 1d4} poison damage. Moreover, if the creature suffers currently from the {@condition poisoned} condition, it takes an additional {@damage 2d6} poison damage.

This spell’s damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the weapon attack deals {@damage 3d4} poison damage to the target on a hit, and the extra poison damage increases to {@dice 4d6}. Both damage rolls increase by two damage dice at 11th level ({@dice 5d4} and {@dice 6d6}) and again at 17th level ({@dice 7d4} and {@dice 8d6}).

spell.name: Vicious Vapors

components.m: A clipping from a poisonous plant

entries: You fill the air with a poisonous vapors in a cube 10 feet on each side. A creature must make a Constitution saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on their turn or starts its turn there. On a failed save, they take {@damage 2d12} poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, they take half as much damage and do not become {@condition poisoned}.
You can move the cloud of vapors up to 20 feet as a bonus action during your turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Aurelius's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells with his druidic focus.

trait.name: Wild Shape: (<input type = "checkbox"> <input type = "checkbox">/Short Rest)
entries: You can use your action to transform into a {@creature Dire Wolf}, {@creature Giant Owl}, {@creature Fox|IDRotF}, {@creature Saber-Toothed Tiger}.
You gain the beast's hit points on top of your current hit points. When your beast form loses all of its hit points, the excess damage carries over to your humanoid form.
You can't cast spells while in your animal form. However, you can continue concentrating on spells you have already cast, and you can take spell actions (i.e. moving {@spell moonbeam}).

action.name: Shillelagh
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6+4}) damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8+4}) damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Ray of Frost
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage, and the target's movement speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

spellcasting.name: 4. Normal Spellcasting
headerEntries: Spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks.

trait.name: 1. Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Strahd fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: 2. Shapechanger
entries: Action to polymorph into:
Tiny or Medium bat - 50ft
Medium or Large Wolf - 60ft
Medium cloud of mist - 20ft
While in mist form, He has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and he is immune to all nonmagical damage except the damage he takes from sunlight.

trait.name: 3. Misty Escape
entries: At 0 hit points, reforms in coffin {@condition unconscious} and {@condition paralyzed} until next dusk.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Regains 25 hit points at the start of his turn.

trait.name: Unholy Persistence
entries: Strahd has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead, and is only turned for one turn if he fails the saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Three attacks (magical), only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Unarmed Strike/Longsword (Vampire or Wolf Form Only).
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit.
({@dice 1d8 + 5}) slashing, ({@dice 2d6}) necrotic. Forgo slashing damage to grapple ({@dc 19}).

action.name: Skilled Swordsman {@recharge 4}
entries: Disarming Attack
STR save, object lands at his feet.
Pushing Attack
STR save, push up to 15ft.
Trip Attack
STR save, knock {@condition prone}.
Wounding Attack
CON save, {@dice 3d6} necrotic{@dice  + 3d6} necrotic at start of turn. MED check ({@dc 15}) or healing to fix.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit against {@condition grappled}, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}.
{@h} ({@dice 1d6 + 5}) piercing, ({@dice 3d6}) necrotic. Hit point max reduced by necrotic and heals.

action.name: Charm
entries: Humanoid: {@dc 20} WIS save. 24 hour duration, save again if harmed.

action.name: Children of the Night (1/Day)
entries: Calls reinforcements appropriate to situation.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Strahd moves up to his walking speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Attacks once with Unarmed Strike/Longsword.

legendary.name: Spell
entries: 3rd level or lower.

legendary.name: Bite (costs 2 actions)
entries: Strahd makes one bite attack.

legendary.name: Darkness (costs 3 actions, {@recharge 6})
entries: Strahd eliminates every source of natural light within 120ft of him and fills that area with magical darkness until the end of his next turn. Magical sources of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower are automatically dispelled. Strahd can see through this darkness normally.

monster.name: The Mad Mage of Mount Baratok

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mad mage is a 25th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Mad Mage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spellmaster
entries: The Mad Mage can cast as many spells as he wishes, up to a combined level of 5. A cantrip counts as a 1st level spell. He cannot cast a spell more than once per turn.

action.name: Shocking Grasp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) lightning damage, and the target cannot take reactions until the start of their next turn.

reaction.name: Reactive
entries: The Mad Mage can take up to 3 reactions every round.

reaction.name: Spellbreak (1/tround)
entries: If a creature casts a spell against the Mad Mage, he can force that creature to make a contested ability check with their spellcasting ability modifier against his. If he succeeds, the spell is redirected back at the caster.

monster.tokenUrl: https://5e.tools/img/CoS/The Mad Mage of Mount Baratok.png

spellcasting.name: 1 Spellcasting
headerEntries: Rand is a 13th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks).
Rand has the following wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: If Rand attempts to cast a leveled spell while under the effects of {@spell mind blank}, he must make an Intelligence check of 10 + the level of the spell. On a success, the spell is cast. On a failure, the casting fails and the spell slot is wasted.
will: {@spell mind blank} (self only. When cast, Rand has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws as he loses himself to amnesia and paranoia)

trait.name: {@creature Aberrant Spirit|TCE}
entries: <label for="name">Aberrant Spirit HP (40)</label><input type="text" id="HP" name="HP">
Slaad: Regenerate 5 HP
{@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, {@damage 1d10+7} slashing damage, can't regain hit points
Star Spawn: Whispering Aura (5 ft. range, WIS save, {@damage 2d6} psychic damage)
{@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, {@damage 1d8+7} psychic damage
Beholderkin
{@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 150 ft., {@damage 1d8+7} psychic damage

action.name: Improvised Dagger.
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage. If any creature using this dagger rolls a 1 on the attack roll, it breaks and becomes nonmagical.

action.name: Minor Conjuration
entries: Rand can use his action to conjure up an inanimate object in his hand or on the ground in an unoccupied space that he can see within 10 feet of him. This object can be no larger than 3 feet on a side and weigh no more than 10 pounds, and its form must be that of a nonmagical object that he has seen. The object is visibly magical, radiating dim light out to 5 feet.
The object disappears after 1 minute, when he uses this feature again, or if it takes or deals any damage.

spellcasting.name: 1 Spellcasting
headerEntries: Victor is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks).
Victor has the following wizard spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: 2 Spellbook
headerEntries: Victor has additional spells he can prepare in his spellbook.<details>

spellcasting.name: 3 Staff of Power (20 charges) <input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox"><input type="checkbox">

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: {@item cloak of protection}, {@item staff of power}

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Staff of Power
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If Volenta surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If Volenta moves at least 10 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition grappled} by Volenta.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Volenta has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of Volenta's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: Volenta has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Evasive Escape
entries: Opportunity attacks against Volenta are made at disadvantage.

trait.name: <details><summary>Vampire Traits
entries: </summary>
<strong style="font-weight:normal"><i style="font-style:normal">
Regeneration
Regains 20 hit points at start of turn unless she takes radiant damage.
Spider Climb
Volenta can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check..
Sunlight Hypersensitivity
Volenta takes 20 radiant damage when she starts her turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, she has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.
Sunlight Hypersensitivity
Volenta has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
</details>

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Volenta makes three attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Savage Bite
entries: {@hit 9} to hit.
Willing, {@condition grappled}, {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition restrained}, or {@condition prone}.
{@h} ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage (lingering).
<details>

Volenta can bite a chunk of flesh out of any creature that is hit by her bite attack. The creature is grievously wounded, and takes ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The wound ends if the target regains any hit points or if a creature uses an action to staunch the wound, which requires a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom (Medicine) check. If she uses this ability on a humanoid, she regains an additional 10 hit points at the start of her next turn.
</details>
Deep bite: Wounded ({@damage 3d6}), {@dc 15} Med check. Regains 10 additional HP.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@hit 9} to hit.
{@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, Volenta can leap onto and grapple the target (escape {@dc 20}).

action.name: Poisoned Dart
entries: {@hit 9} to hit.
Range 40/120 ft.

{@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must make a constitution saving throw ({@dc 14}) or take an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and be {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

bonus.name: Rampage
entries: When Volenta reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on her turn, Volenta can take a bonus action to move up to half her speed and make a Claw attack.

bonus.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, Volenta can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Dodge
entries: Volenta adds 5 to her AC against one attack that would hit her. To do so, she must be able to see the attacker.

reaction.name: Awful Evasion {@recharge 5}
entries: When she would be hit by an attack roll, Volenta can instead disappear from her current location, reappearing behind the creature that would have hit her. She can then make one claw attack against that creature with advantage.

legendary.name: Mask of Night
entries: Volenta's mask, a gift from Strahd, gives her the ability to summon two phantom wolves to aid her in combat. These wolves have one hit point, have the Evasion feature, and deal force damage on hit, but otherwise their stats are the same as a normal wolf. They until destroyed, dispelled, or until one minute has passed.

trait.name: Unholy Beauty
entries: At the start of her turn, Anastrasya can choose whether she will be in her Beautiful Form or her Lifeless Form. While below half health or when a holy symbol is being presented to her, she is forced into her Lifeless Form and targets {@condition charmed} by her are released from her control.
In her Beautiful Form, her AC is 18 as creatures are unwilling to attack her for her beauty, and she can use her charm powers.
In her Lifeless Form, her AC is 16, she gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and she can use her dire powers.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If Anastrasya fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Vampire Traits
entries: <details>
<strong style="font-weight:normal"><i style="font-style:normal">
Regeneration
Regains 10 hit points at start of turn unless she takes radiant damage.
Spider Climb
Anastrasya can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check..
Sunlight Hypersensitivity
Anastrasya takes 20 radiant damage when she starts her turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, she has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.
Sunlight Hypersensitivity
Anastrasya has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
</details>

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Anastrasya makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@hit 9} to hit.
Willing, {@condition grappled} creature, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}.
{@h} ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage (lingering).

action.name: Claws
entries: {@hit 9} to hit.
{@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) slashing damage.
Lifeless Form: additional {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage.
Instead of dealing slashing damage, Anastrasya can grapple the target (escape {@dc 19}).

action.name: Charm
entries: <details>Anastrasya targets one humanoid she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see Anastrasya, the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed}. The {@condition charmed} target regards Anastrasya as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. The target isn’t under Anastrasya’s control, but it takes Anastrasya’s requests and actions in the most favorable way and lets Anastrasya bite it.</details>
{@dc 17} Wisdom save, {@condition charmed} on failure.
The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns during combat, or every minute outside of combat. Otherwise, the effect ends after 1 hour.

reaction.name: Gormless Defender (Beautiful Form)
entries: When a creature within reach of a target who is {@condition charmed} by Anastrasya targets the vampire with a harmful ability, she can force the {@condition charmed} creature to make a melee attack against that creature using its reaction.

reaction.name: Catch Blow (Lifeless Form)
entries: When Anastrasya is hit by a melee attack from a creature within her reach, she can use her reaction to attempt to grapple that creature or knock it away, in which case that creature makes a strength saving throw ({@dc 19}). On a failure, the creature is knocked up to 15 feet away in a direction she chooses and lands {@condition prone}. If the creature instead hits a solid object, it takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and lands {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Stunning Beauty (Beautiful Form)
entries: Anastrasya takes on an appearance of unearthly beauty, which affects every creature within 5ft of her that can see her. All affected creatures are {@condition charmed} by Anastrasya until the start of her next turn. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the creature must make a wisdom saving throw ({@dc 17}) in order to be able to harm her in any way.

legendary.name: Dire Gaze (Lifeless Form)
entries: Anastrasya targets one creature within 15ft of her with a deathly stare. That creature must succeed a wisdom saving throw ({@dc 17}) or be {@condition frightened} of Anastrasya until the start of her next turn.

monster.name: Beucephalus, the Wonder Horse
languages: understands Abyssal, Common, and Infernal but can't speak

trait.name: Confer Fire Resistance
entries: Beucephalus can grant resistance to fire damage to anyone riding him.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: Beucephalus sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

trait.name: Trail of Flame
entries: Whenever Beucephalus moves within 5 feet of a creature or an object that isn't being worn or carried after using at least 30 feet of movement, it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage from his trail of heat. A creature or object can take this damage only once during a turn.

trait.name: Heated Body
entries: Any creature of Beucephalus' choice that touches him or hits him with a melee attack while within 5 feet of him takes 7 ({@dice 2d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Wall of Fire ( <input type= "checkbox">/Short Rest)
entries: Beucephalus casts the spell {@spell wall of fire} without requiring any components, using his movement to define the wall's area.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Beucephalus exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Ethereal Stride
entries: Beucephalus and up to three willing creatures within 5 feet of him magically enter the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

legendary.name: Ethereal Stride
entries: Beucephalus enters or exits the ethereal plane alone.

Sunlight Hypersensitivity
Gertruda has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
</details>

entries: Gertruda makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Bite

{@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage (lingering).

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit.
{@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.
Grapple escape {@dc 16}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks.

reaction.name: Cower
entries: When she would be struck by a melee attack, Gertruda can add her Charisma modifier (+5) to her AC, including against the triggering attack. If this causes the attack to miss, Gertruda can move up half her movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

reaction.name: Terrified Scream {@recharge 5}
entries: When she sees an ally be struck down, the horror of the fight overwhelms Gertruda and she lets out an awful cry. Every creature hostile to her within a 120 foot radius must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they become {@condition frightened} of her until the start of her next turn. On a success, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against her.

monster.name: Zrin-Hala, the Howling Storm

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Zrin-Hala's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: 01 Legendary Resistance ( <input type="checkbox"> <input type="checkbox"> <input type="checkbox">/Day)
entries: If Zrin-Hala fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Zrin-Hala has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Multiple Heads <input>
entries: Zrin-Hala has five heads. While it has more than one head, Zrin-Hala has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.
Whenever Zrin-Hala takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies.

At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn. If it has taken radiant since its last turn, it regrows only one head. Zrin-Hala regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head Zrin-Hala has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

trait.name: <details><summary>Immortal
entries: </summary>

<strong style="font-weight:normal"><i style="font-style:normal">Zrin-Hala cannot be killed. If it is reduced to 0 hit points, it's avatar splits into 2 identical avatars one size category smaller than the original and with half as many hit points. This continues until the avatar becomes Tiny, at which point it splits into identical Tiny avatars. The avatars share the same pool of Legendary actions, but cannot take them if their size is reduced to large or smaller.

The only way to defeat Zrin-Hala is to imprison him back in the Amber Temple. Each standing stone in Eva's Fane must be charged with 20 damage of a type specified by the stone (cold, lighting, thunder, radiant). After this is complete, Zrin-Hala no longer splits upon death, and avatars are destroyed when reduced to 0 hit points.
</details>

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Zrin-Hala makes as many bite attacks as it has heads. It can sacrifice one of these attacks to use its breath weapon if it is available or to cast a spell with a casting time of one action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold, lightning, or thunder damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: Zrin-Hala exhales a energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) damage of a type chosen by Zrin-Hala: cold, lightning, or thunder. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and suffers no secondary effects.
Cold: The creature is {@condition restrained} until the end of their next turn.
Lightning: The creature is {@condition stunned} until the beginning of their next turn.
Thunder: The creature is knocked up to 30 feet away, landing {@condition prone}, and is {@condition deafened} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: Zrin-Hala polymorphs into a Medium humanoid. While in polymorphed form, the faint sounds of a violent storm can be heard around it, and static electricity can be felt in the air. It can remain in polymorphed form for up to 1 hour. Reverting to its true form requires an action.

action.name: Summon Breath (1/Day)
entries: After Zrin-Hala uses its breath weapon, three {@creature animated breath||animated breaths} appear in the cone, either lighting or cold variants.

legendary.name: Lighting Teleport
entries: Zrin-Hala magically teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Anything Zrin-Hala is wearing or carrying is teleported with it.

legendary.name: Wings of Thunder (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Zrin-Hala beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of Zrin-Hala must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) thunder damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. Zrin-Hala can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Suffocate (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Zrin-Hala steals the air of one breathing creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes ({@damage 2d10}) cold damage and can't breathe or speak until the end of its next turn. If it takes an action during that turn, it gains a level of {@condition exhaustion}.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: Zrin-Hala can use the following actions in his lair. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Zrin-Hala takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; it can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Zrin-Hala drops the temperature of the air, covering all surfaces with ice. This effect is identical to the {@spell sleet storm} spell.

Zrin-Hala controls the surrounding air as an extension of itself. Each creature Zrin-Hala designates must succeed at a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or be hoisted or flung {@dice 3d6 × 10} feet through the air. A creature smashed into a solid object or released in mid-air takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet moved or fallen.

Zrin-Hala creates a torrent of debris within 120 feet of him that lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round. The debris lightly obscures every creature and object in the area for the duration. All creatures in the area must succeed at a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until initiative count 20 on the next round.

legendaryHeader: Zrin-Hala can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Zrin-Hala regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the specter moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entries: When a creature within 30 feet of Brunjorn makes an attack roll, he can use his reaction using Channel Divinity to grant that creature a +10 bonus to the roll (after the roll but before knowing the result).

entries: Argynvost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. He takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if he ends his turn inside an object.

entries: If Argynvost fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Bound to Argynvostholt
entries: Argynvost cannot leave the mountain on which Argynvostholt rests. If he dies, he returns to life with all of his hit points in {@dice 1d4} days, appearing in his tomb.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Argynvost regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If Argynvost takes damage from a magic weapon or spell, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Argynvost dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Spirit Form
entries: Argynvost can change his size between large and huge at will.

action.name: Cold Breath
entries: Argynvost exhales an icy blast in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 40 ({@damage 10d8}) cold damage, or half as much on a success.

action.name: Paralyzing Breath
entries: Argynvost exhales a paralyzing gas in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Restoring Breath

Argynvost can then fly up to half of his flying speed.

The area is considered difficult terrain until Argynvost takes another lair action.

mythic.name: Infusion
