trait.name: <font size= 3>Angelic Weapons</font>
entries: The Abbot's weapon attacks are magical. When the Abbot hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 4d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: <font size= 3>Magic Resistance</font>
entries: The Abbot has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Abbot makes two melee attacks. He can replace one of these attacks with a use of Corrupted Healing or by casting a spell with a casting time of one action.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft.
{@h} ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Corrupted Healing (<input type= "checkbox"><input type= "checkbox"><input type= "checkbox">/Day)
entries: {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft.
{@h} ({@damage 4d8+2}) healing.
<details>The Abbot touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 ({@dice 4d8 + 2}) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.
If the creature is reduced to 0 hit points in the next hour, the creature is transformed into a Star Spawn of an equal or lower challenge rating to their level or existing CR.</details>

action.name: Life Drain {@recharge 5}
entries: {@hit +10} to hit, reach 5 ft.
{@h} ({@damage 4d8 + 2}) necrotic damage, regains equal hit points.

<details>The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
If the target fails the saving throw, the Abbot regains one use of Corrupted Healing.</details>

action.name: Change Shape
entries: <details>The Abbot magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than his own, or back into his true form. He reverts to its true form if he dies. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the Abbot's choice).

In a new form, the Abbot retains his game statistics and ability to speak, but his AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and he gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that he lacks.</details>

An angel is a celestial agent sent forth into the planes to further its god's agenda for weal or woe. Its sublime beauty and presence can drive awestruck onlookers to their knees. Yet angels are destroyers too, and their appearance portends doom as often as it signals hope.

entries.name: Shards of the Divine
entries: Angels are formed from the astral essence of benevolent gods and are thus divine beings of great power and foresight.

Angels act out the will of their gods with tireless devotion. Even chaotic good deities command lawful good angels, knowing that the angels' dedication to order best allows them to fulfill divine commands. An angel follows a single driving purpose, as decreed by its deity. However, an angel is incapable of following commands that stray from the path of law and good.

An angel slays evil creatures without remorse. As the embodiment of law and good, an angel is almost never mistaken in its judgments. This quality can create a sense of superiority in an angel, a sense that comes to the fore when an angel's task conflicts with the goals of another creature. The angel never acquiesces or gives way. When an angel is sent to aid mortals, it is sent not to serve but to command. The gods of good therefore send their angels among mortals only in response to the most dire circumstances.

entries.name: Fallen Angels
entries: An angel's moral compass grants it a sense of infallibility that can sometimes spell its undoing. Angels are usually too wise to fall for a simple deception, but sometimes pride can lead one to commit an evil act. Whether intentional or accidental, such an act is a permanent stain that marks the angel as an outcast. Fallen angels retain their power but lose their connection to the deities from which they were made. Most fallen angels take their banishment personally, rebelling against the powers they served by seeking rulership over a section of the Abyss or a place among other fallen in the hierarchy of the Nine Hells. Zariel, the ruler of the first layer of the Nine Hells, is such a creature. Rather than rebel, some fallen angels resign themselves to an isolated existence on the Material Plane, living in disguise as simple hermits. If they are redeemed, they can become powerful allies dedicated to justice and compassionate service.

entries.name: Immortal Nature
entries: An angel doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Deva
entries: Devas are angels that act as divine messengers or agents to the Material Plane, the Shadowfell, and the Feywild and that can assume a form appropriate to the realm they are sent to.

Legend tells of angels that take mortal form for years, lending aid, hope, and courage to goodhearted folk. A deva can take any shape, although it prefers to appear to mortals as an innocuous humanoid or animal. When circumstances require that it cast off its guise, a deva is a beautiful humanoid-like creature with silvery skin. Its hair and eyes gleam with an unearthly luster, and large feathery wings unfurl from its shoulder blades.

legendary.name: <font size= 3>Mace</font>
entries: The Abbot makes a mace attack.

legendary.name: <font size= 3>Life Drain</font>
entries: The Abbot uses Life Drain if it is available.

legendary.name: <font size= 3>The Bill Comes Due</font>
entries: The Abbot targets a creature who owes him. The target is reduced to 0 hit points and the Abbot gains temporary hit points equal to their maximum.

{@dc 18} INT save. On failure, cannot take reactions and disadvantage on attacks until end of target's next turn.

entries: Range 60 ft., {@dc 18} INT save.
Failure: {@damage 6d8} psychic damage, and the Abbot restores equal hit points to one creature within 5 feet of him.
Success: {@damage 3d8} psychic damage.
If target is healed to full, they become a Star Spawn under the Abbot's control. They return to their normal if the Abbot dies within 24 hours.

trait.name: Blind Rage
entries: The sorrowsworn has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, or knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Rising Anger
entries: If another creature deals damage to the sorrowsworn, the sorrowsworn's attack rolls have advantage until the end of its next turn, and the first time it hits with a Hook attack on its next turn, the attack's target takes an extra 19 ({@damage 3d12}) psychic damage.
On its turn, the sorrowsworn has disadvantage on attack rolls if no other creature has dealt damage to it since the end of its last turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sorrowsworn makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft.
{@h} ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

Relying on violence to sustain their existence, angry sorrowsworn—sometimes called the Angry—grow more powerful when their foes fight back. If a creature opts not to attack, though, this sorrowsworn becomes confused, and its attacks weaken. It also has two heads, which bicker with each other incessantly.

entries.name: Sorrowsworn
entries: The Shadowfell's pervasive melancholy sometimes gives rise to strange incarnations of the plane's bleak nature. Sorrowsworn embody the forms of suffering inherent to the shadowy landscape and visit horror on those who stumble into their midst. Each sorrowsworn personifies a different aspect of despair or distress.

entries: </summary>A creature that grapples godsvessel while within 5 feet of him or is {@condition grappled} by him takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) slashing damage. A creature takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) slashing damage if it starts its turn grappling or being {@condition grappled} by the godsvessel.

trait.name: <details><summary>Charge
entries: </summary>If the godsvessel moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its Greatsword of Slaughter on the same turn, the target takes an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

entries: </summary>The godsvessel can only be reduced to 0 hit points by a critical hit.

trait.name: Impossible hunger
entries: The godsvessel can eat anything.
Depending on the object consumed, it gains one of the following benefits until it eats a different type of material or one minute has elapsed.
Flesh - Regenerates twice as many hit points.
Plants - Attacks apply {@condition restrained} on hit.
Earth - Attacks apply slowed (1/2 move speed) to target.
Stone - Gains resistance (15) to all damage.
Water - Form becomes malleable, gains amorphous trait.
Metal - AC increases to 20.
Magical object or summon - Gains magic resistance.
If the godsvessel eats something with multiple materials, it gains the trait associated with the primary material.

entries: </summary>
No restriction while in darkness.
Difficult terrain while illuminated.

trait.name: <details><summary>Light Snack
entries: </summary>The godsvessel can consume non-magical light sources, regaining 30 hit points for each one devoured.

trait.name: 1. Incarnation of Darkness.
entries: The godsvessel can grow in size to completely fill any area of complete darkness that it is within, making it magical, up to a maximum size of 200 feet in any dimension. The darkness can only be dispelled by magical light.
Exposing any area of that darkness to magical light allows that area to be damaged.

trait.name: Formless
entries: The godsvessel is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Absence
entries: Reach 5ft, one target, basic CON saving throw ({@dc 20}): {@damage 5d10} cold damage.

entries: Reach 5ft, one target, {@hit 18} to hit.
{@h}{@damage 5d6} psychic damage. Target makes a Charisma saving throw.
<11: {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, muted, {@condition restrained}.
11-15: {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}.
16-20: {@condition blinded}.
>20: no effect.
Effect lasts until end of target's next turn.

entries: If Antithesis fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If destroyed, Antithesis reforms within 10 miles of the place he was destroyed with all of his hit points 1 day later.

trait.name: Nothingness
entries: Any creature or nonmagical object which touches Antithesis takes {@damage 3d10} force damage. Any creature he kills is completely erased from existance, and any nonmagical object he touches is utterly destroyed where he intersected with it.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: Antithesis can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. Any creature he passes through must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 5d10} force damage, and any nonmagical object he moves through is reduced to dust.

trait.name: Voidsight
entries: Antithesis can see through nonmagical objects out to a range of 120 feet. This vision is blocked by even transparent magical objects.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Antithesis can't be affected or detected by spells of 5th level or lower unless he wishes to be.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}35 ({@damage 5d10 + 8}) force damage.

action.name: Thought
entries: Antithesis thinks of a creature within 120 feet of him. The creature must make a {@dc 24} Charisma saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} psychic damage on a failure or half as much on a success.

legendaryGroup.name: Zrin-Hala, the Howling Storm
lairActions: Zrin-Hala can use the following actions in his lair. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Zrin-Hala takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; it can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:",

items: Zrin-Hala drops the temperature of the air, covering all surfaces with ice. This effect is identical to the {@spell sleet storm} spell.

Zrin-Hala controls the surrounding air as an extension of itself. Each creature Zrin-Hala designates must succeed at a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or be hoisted or flung {@dice 3d6 × 10} feet through the air. A creature smashed into a solid object or released in mid-air takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet moved or fallen.

Zrin-Hala creates a torrent of debris within 120 feet of him that lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round. The debris lightly obscures every creature and object in the area for the duration. All creatures in the area must succeed at a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until initiative count 20 on the next round.
